questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to use some of its Marketing Cloud data in Data Cloud.
Which engagement channel data will require custom integration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. Adding more RULES to the RULESET increases the match rate
C. More dupe, more match rate.

however, adding more CRITERIA decreases the match rate, just a reminder.

Selected Answer: BC
BC is right

questions.question_text:
A customer notices that their consolidation rate has recently increased. They contact the consultant to ask why.
What are two likely explanations for the increase? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Identity resolution rules have been added to the ruleset to increase the number of matched profiles.
choices.D: Identity resolution rules have been removed to reduce the number of matched profiles.
choices.C: New data sources have been added to Data Cloud that largely overlap with the existing profiles.
choices.A: Duplicates have been removed from source system data streams.

choices.C: Dedicated S3 data sources in activation setup
choices.D: Separate user credentials for data stream and activation target
choices.A: Multiple S3 connectors in Data Cloud setup
choices.B: Dedicated S3 data sources in Data Cloud setup

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Multiple S3 connectors in Data Cloud setup explicitly supports separate S3 buckets for data ingestion and activation. While D mentions access control, it does not achieve the configuration-level separation required for this scenario.

Selected Answer: D
answer is D, B only relates with ingestion and cannot do anything about activation.

Selected Answer: D
answer is D, you will need to configure the credentials separately for ingestion, and separately for the data action / target

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B
Other sources say D: Separate user credentials...

questions.question_text: Which configuration supports separate Amazon S3 buckets for data ingestion and activation?
How does Data Cloud handle an individual's Right to be Forgotten?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When handling an individual's Right to be Forgotten in Salesforce Data Cloud, the system deletes the specified individual record and its associated Unified Individual Link record, ensuring compliance with privacy regulations like GDPR and CCPA by removing identifiable data while maintaining system integrity

Selected Answer: B
B is it

Selected Answer: B
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.c360_a_data_deletion_request.htm&type=5
It's B. "A Data Deletion request deletes the specified individual record from the Individual DMO and the related DMOs."

Selected Answer: B
I think B is correct.

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D

choices.C: Deletes the records from all data source objects, and any downstream data model objects are updated at the next scheduled ingestion.
choices.D: Deletes the specified Individual record and its Unified Individual Link record.
choices.B: Deletes the specified Individual and records from any data model object/data lake object related to the Individual.
choices.A: Deletes the specified Individual and records from any data source object mapped to the Individual data model object.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. “branch” (dimension) is the correct choice because dimensions, unlike metrics, can be included as attributes in activations. B. “banking value” (metric) is not applicable for activation attributes

Selected Answer: B
only metrics options are available in activation for Calc Insights

Selected Answer: B
B it is
I think it should be B - "banking value" as only a metric can be added as an attribute. Dimensions can be used for filtration in activations.

questions.question_text:
Cumulus Financial uses calculated insights to compute the total banking value per branch for its high net worth customers. In the calculated insight, "banking value" is a metric, "branch" is a dimension, and "high net worth" is a filter.
What can be included as an attribute in activation?
